intro: Tylophora carnosa, commonly known as the hairy tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or greenish-white in color. Tylophora carnosa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Its morphology includes hairy foliage, which contributes to its common name.
